runs.comm: well, that's just the start England would have been hoping for as a leg-stump half volley is dispatched with ease behind square on the leg side.

leg-stump line once more from Razzaq, although this time the damage is minimal as the ball is tapped gently into the leg side. He will need to find his radar quickly though, Pakistan don't have all that many runs to play with
wide of off and left alone by Kieswetter, who looks just a tad nervous
that's a much better line, zoning in on off stump, and he's pulled the length back a touch as well. Tapped defensively back to the bowler
Kieswetter leaves alone once more as Razzaq finds some movement away from the right-hander both in the air and off the pitch

dropped! Razzaq pitched it up, full and straight and Kieswetter chipped straight to Ajmal at mid on. He looked to have taken it cleanly, but the ball bobbled out of his hand as he went to celebrate! Shades of Gibbs at the '99 World Cup...
Lumb shimmies down first ball to work the ball through midwicket
short and Lumb works with the little width on offer to slap the ball down to third man
drop-and-run from Kieswetter as the ball rolls just wide of square leg. Good, sharp single
Lumb aims an ungainly heave over midwicket but misses the ball entirely. They run a single though, as the ball bobbles off the pads to the off side
Kieswetter dances down and aims a Karim Sadiq-esque mow over the covers, but he was nowhere near it
stays deep in the crease this time to pull a short-ish ball out to deep square leg
he rolls the fingers over one to start and Kieswetter is nonplussed, standing rooted in the crease and hanging his bat out as the ball scoots by
misdirected from Aamer, as the ball swings down leg. Good take by the 'keeper
chipped again, just over Ajmal's head at mid on! He got a finger to it, but it wasn't the most athletic of attempts
no incident this time as the ball is tapped defensively to point
Kieswetter lofts one-handed out to deep midwicket, and luckily for him the ball lands safely in the outfield.
stays back to defend a shorter ball into the covers

ooh, superb bowling! Aamer lands the ball on a length outside off stump, angling across the right hander rather than swinging in and Kieswetter has a little nibble at it. He was lucky not to get an edge there
Smeared! Lumb skips down the track and lofts a length ball handsomely way over deep square leg. Savage blow!
watchful defence from Lumb after the monstrous strike off the previous ball
Lumb goes over the off side this time, again coming down the wicket to meet the ball and crunching the ball over the covers. And England are away!
clipped down to fine leg this time
or at least he had been struggling, as Kieswetter adopts Lumb's technique, running down the wicket to slap the ball very hard through the covers
classic Twenty20 shot, Kieswetter tries to hoick over midwicket but the ball takes the top edge, flying over the keeper and down to the third man boundary
poor bowling from Aamer, and Lumb takes full toll, clipping a leg-side delivery down to fine leg with ease

oh, Ajmal! Another drop! That was a dolly as Lumb slapped a low full toss straight to him, once again he looked to have taken it but as he tumbled over in taking the catch the ball bobbled out of his hands. Afridi holds his head in despair, and one really feels for Ajmal here
fired in wide of off to beat Kieswetter's wild swish
driven firmly but straight to mid off
back of a length on off stump, and Kieswetter chops the ball out to point
he backs away this time, way outside leg, but Aamer follows him with a shorter ball. Kieswetter drops his hands on the shot as the ball whizzes past his grill
Lumb is on the offensive immediately, swiping out to deep midwicket
well bowled, he held it back a touch and a hint of turn beat Kieswetter's defensive prod to strike him on the pad. Half an appeal is quickly quashed
full and clipped out to the leg side

Gone! Stumped! Ajmal begins to make amends for his poor fielding with a great piece of bowling. Again he tossed the ball up bravely, Lumb took a couple of steps down the track looking for the leg-side heave but was beaten in the flight, and Kamran completed a smart stumping
woops, we almost have the Red Bull run first ball, but KP is wisely sent back
they collect a run as the ball comes off the pad and trickles to fine leg's right
too straight, and Pietersen works the ball with the turn out onto the leg side for a single
straight again, too straight and Kieswetter taps the ball into space on the leg side for another run
Pietersen comes down the track to hit with the spin in the air out to wide long on, but there's a man out there to cut it off
Hafeez needs to change his line here, this one is fired down leg and rightly given wide

huge! Kieswetter used his feet to great effect to get to the pitch and crunch a massive blow onto the roof of the Sir Garfield Sobers pavilion. A monstrous strike, to be sure, and the ball appears to have taken a chunk out of the side of the pavilion. And they bring out a new ball...
leg side again, but it was the right ball to bowl this time as Kieswetter came down the track again and was lucky to get a boot on it
good, tight line to finish from Hafeez as a quicker ball is speared in at off stump and Kieswetter gets right behind it to defend

slapped over the covers first ball by Pietersen! The ball was pitched up on off stump and Pietersen made good contact as he hit with the spin over the infield. Diving effort on the boundary fails to cut it off
shorter and quicker this time, and KP hangs back to slice the ball down to third man
hit back to the bowler
was that a wrong 'un, or an offie? The ball turned in to Pietersen's pads and is worked away to the leg side for a single
flighted this time, and pushed through the covers for one
great ball! Came in to the right-hander once again, but he didn't seem to pick this one and was tucked up quite nicely

gone! Safe hands from Umar as Kieswetter came down the track and hit this ball up into the stratosphere. Umar circled underneath it at long on for what seemed like an age, and managed to cling on the the steepling chance. Thank goodness it wasn't Ajmal down there!
slower ball, leg-cutter and Pietersen comes down the wicket to drive the ball down to long on
sharp movement in to Collingwood, but the line is too straight and he works it with the angle out to square leg to get off the mark
too straight again, and Pietersen walks across his stumps and flicks out to fine leg with confidence
on a length on off stump and Pietersen drives to long off as the batsmen complete a leisurely single
just outside off this time, and the ball holds its line to beat Collingwood's leaden-footed force off the back foot
swept very hard out to deep square leg by Pietersen
full and flighted and driven to long off
slightly shorter, and quick too and KP stayed back to try and cut, but was beaten by some exaggerated bounce

driven out through the covers, and Pietersen has pinged himself as he went through with the shot, clipping his left ankle with the bat. Ouch! He's down and the physio is out, but it doesn't look too serious. A painful blow though. Is that his dodgy ankle? Shockingly, Sahil can't remember...
driven to long off, and Pietersen hobbles through for one
hit very hard back past the bowler and down to long off.
great shot! Came down the track and across too to slap a length ball down to fine leg. The fielder was up and that's raced away. No sign of a dodgy ankle there!
dropped! Hit very hard straight back at Razzaq, he got his hands to it but couldn't hold on, and another chance goes begging!

well, that's gotta hurt! The very next ball Pietersen hammers a long hop out to the cover boundary. He really hit the covers off that one, there was a fielder out there but he couldn't get round to cut it off
pushed to Razzaq's left and down to long off for one
straight, and coming in off the seam, Colly nurdles behind square on the leg side and they amble through for another
full and angling in to the pads, Pietersen stands at the crease to clip firmly out to wide long on, where the fielder sprints round to cut off a well-timed shot
drifting in, gripping and turning away, Collingwood trues to run it down to third man but can't beat the man at 45
pushed out through the covers for one
coming in to the pads and clipped to leg for a single

good, intelligent cricket shot there. The ball was short and on his legs, Colly knew where the gap at fine leg was and picked it to perfection with a paddle-pull and the ball rolled away for a boundary
just milking the bowling now, as this one is pushed down to long off
another single and England are cruising now, tapped to long on
length from Asif, and Pietersen walks down the wicket to send the ball down to long on
short, wide and Collingwood cuts hard behind point. The fielder at point got half a hand to it to take some pace off it and third man runs round to cut it off
sharp fielding from Butt, who dives to cut off a backfoot drive on the off side but can't stop the run
struck very firmly out to the cover sweeper, and England collect another run, and the hundred comes up
Asif went for the yorker but just missed his mark, and Pietersen dug the ball out to long on
Collingwood charges down and clips a full ball out to deep midwicket, all too easily
really looped up, but Collingwood didn't take the bait, content to simply drive down to long off. And, with England needing just more than a run-a-ball, why would he do anything else?
lofted by Pietersen down to long off, where Aamer leapt but couldn't stop it, parrying the ball over the rope!
good ball, tapped straight to the fielder on the leg side
and again, he can't get it away
Pietersen looks for the gap behind square on the off side, but again can't quite find it and that's another dot
worked away square again and this time he does beat the fielder, but the sweeper cleans up
short, wide and cut away very hard behind point by Pietersen, who looks like he's having a net out there, such is the ease of his shot-making
Pietersen walks down the wicket to Aamer, who slips in a short ball which is pulled off the hip down to the fielder at fine leg

Collingwood now takes a few steps down the wicket and tries to go inside-out over the off side. He fluffs the shot though, sending the ball swirling over the covers off the splice, but into a vacant area
full, almost a yorker and KP bunts it back to the bowler

full, fast and wide from Aamer, and the ball slips under Pietersen's attempted drive. Good ball, and Pakistan will need a lot more of them in these closing overs if they are to make anything of this game
slower ball, offcutter, but Pietersen spots it and collects a single between the fielders on the off side
no, it's all Pietersen, who skips down and lifts Afridi back over his head with a clean swing of the blade. That's his fifty, and he's found things pretty easy out there
pulls the length back and Pietersen slaps to the cover fielder
fuller and powered into the off side again, but the cover fielder gets himself behind the ball to cut it off
again Pietersen finds the fielder with a shot through the off side
finds the gap this time, and they collect a gentle single

Gone! Afridi strikes with his last ball as Collingwood tries to repeat Pietersen's stroke from earlier in the over but can only send the ball as far as the long on fielder, who holds on to the chance. Will there be a final twist to this match?
length, angling across the left-handed Morgan, who drives into the covers, beating the diving cover fielder to collect a single and get off the mark
full, yorker-length and snaking in to Pietersen through the air, but he walks across to get the ball away behind square on the leg side
full again, but just short of yorker length and Pietersen gets underneath it to clip the ball off one leg out to the square leg boundary. In the slot, and put away!
he pulls the length back now, aiming at off stump and Pietersen is content to just drop the ball into the off side
terrific shot! Low, in-swinging full toss but he sent it back right off the middle of the bat, beating long on for another boundary. Pietersen is in full flow now, middling everything
slightly shorter and hammered into the off side, but straight to the cover fielder
tossed up by Ajmal, and Morgan stretches forward to defend watchfully to the off side
full and floaty, Morgan turns his wrists on this one but can only send it back to the bowler
same again, hit back to Ajmal who collects cleanly
and Morgan, having had a look at a few, sweeps powerfully out to deep midwicket for four. Top shot, right out the middle and England need single figures now
quicker through the air, pushed to the off side

gone! Arm ball from Ajmal, and Morgan didn't pick it! He went back to what he believed to be a short ball, but it came on quickly with the arm to beat his attempted pull and rattle the timber! A sting in the tail? Probably not, with England only needing 8 from 12, but you never know!

well, two pieces of fielding sum up Pakistan's performance completely. Pietersen chopped the ball hard to point's right, but the fielder dived superbly to cut it off and hurled the ball in to the keeper with Pietersen way out of his crease. Kamran caught the return cleanly, but then ran past the stumps without taking the bails off! A terrible miss there...
off the face and down to third man
crunch! Pietersen thumps a full toss past a diving mid off and away to the boundary. All over for Pakistan now...
another full toss, very wide of off and it's driven straight to the cover fielder, with all the fielders in now. Had he left that, it would definitely have been a wide
bouncer from Aamer! KP wasn't expecting that, but he managed to duck his head out of the way just in time
Another bouncer, but Pietersen can't get it away and the match goes in to the final over!
doosra, and Wright can't get it away! Hit gently into the covers. Two from 5 needed now...
scores level as Wright goes down to slog sweep, misses, and they run a leg bye as the ball squirts square on the off side
and there's the game! Short ball, Pietersen stayed deep in his crease and flayed it away through the covers to end the match in fitting style
